notes.text: 68: Multiple telecom elements for custodian
Need to work with PA to get a CMET flavor that more closely aligns with CDA use of custodian organization.
37,66: Custodian Mandatory
44, 48: Added completionCode attribute
62: Made confidentialityCode a DSET. Still need to review vocabulary.
20: LanguageCode is currently set to CD CNE < HumanLanguage (concept domain). 33: Should we relax the CNE to CWE?
50: Added a ClinicalDocumentDefinition act (in DEF mood) to header using the INST AR.
69: Added priorityNumber

Need to seriously consider extending this to all Roles, not just RoleClassAssociative. There are Now participation types that make no sense without some of the partitive roles. New role classes public health dealing with exposures are under the partitive domain. New participations for public health that work with these are already included since the participant is already at the root level.
Expanded the types of entities playing and scoping AssociatedEntity. The RoleClassAssociative class codes Certainly allow/require more than a scoping org and a player person.
35, 65: Added E_Device, but the device info is incomplete. Used E_Person CMET

35: RoleClassMutualRelationship includes role class codes that seem inappropriate, such as * CIT (citizen) player is citizen of scoper, which in CDA is assumed to the RCT * COVPTY (covered party) this is about insurance coverage, scoper covers the player scoper would virtually never be the record target *MIL (military) scoper is the military service Careful analysis of what roles to allow needs to be done.
12: Many of these domains utilize standard CMETs such as R_Patient and R_AssignedEntity to convey common information. The strawman utilizes the same CMETs to promote cross domain consistency.
35: Used CMET for assigned entity which allows device, but the device info is incomplete
Need a value set with these values
30, 41, 46: Added Referrer
2: Added modeCode

constraints.text: Allowed values: AUT, PRF, PPRF, SPRF, REF

notes.text: 41: added to link to order So that ordering physician (i.e., order author) can be picked up for service event.

12: Many of these domains utilize standard CMETs such as R_Patient and R_AssignedEntity to convey common information. The strawman utilizes the same CMETs to promote cross domain consistency. Expanded Author choice to be a choice R_Assigned CMETS for a person or device. This allows a richer set of information to be optionally captured in a fashion consistent with other V3 models.

59: Need to work with PA to develop a new flavor of this CMET that requires the Person playing the assigned role for use with legal authenticator 12: Many of these domains utilize standard CMETs such as R_Patient and R_AssignedEntity to convey common information. The strawman utilizes the same CMETs to promote cross domain consistency.
42: need to work with PA to include employment info for R_AssignedPerson 43: Also need to add Qualified role info to R_Assigned
CDA R2 allowed a Healthchart role here, with a person playing the role of a health chart! I’ve dropped that erroneous capability from this model.
8: IntendedRecipient.code handled by using AssignedPerson CMET.
Need ParticipationSignature value set CDA R2 supported S and X (deprecated), So perhaps in R3 we need only the value S in which case we could just fix the value At S.
61: Added signatureText
61: Added signatureText
Need ParticipationSignature value set CDA R2 supported S and X (deprecated), So perhaps in R3 we need only the value S in which case we could just fix the value At S.
17: Added modeCode to handle electronic consults in encounters
Should we just add RESP tp x_EncounterParticipants?

Changed the vocab for HealthCareFacility.code from the ServiceDeliveryLocationRoleType value set to the HealthcareServiceLocation concept domain. We have examples of CDA IG’s that use other coding systems besides the HL7 RoleCode coding system.
classCode should be CRED but that’s not working in the tooling.
Need a concept domain for CredentialedRoleType
40, 54: Added Accredited Location
If this is added to the E_Place CMET we could use the R_ServiceDeliveryLocation CMET instead for HealthcareFacility, bringing with how other domains (including PA) are modeling service locations.

The Encounter CMET does everything EncompassingEncounter does, plus much more. Major differences between Encounter CMET and EncompassingEncounter include *the id attribute is mandatory (can’t be null) *has a mandatory Patient CMET as the subject of the encounter * need to propose adding accredited location information * responsibleParty is an organization in the assigned role, not a person We would want to work with PA to make these changes. We can also work with PA to get a flavor of the CMET that is more palatable to CDA.
65: for device information
35, 65: Has more complete device info than E_Device but uses the INST role, not RoleClassMutual.
61 Added signatureText
46: Ordering Provider is the author of the order.
sequenceNumber added for compatibility With order message models
6: Added subject
47,64: Used R_patient and R_InvestigativeSubject CMETs as record target and subject to meet new requirements. Allows documentation of any entity as record target or subject of CDA.
12: Many of these domains utilize standard CMETs such as R_Patient and R_AssignedEntity to convey common information. The strawman utilizes the same CMETs to promote cross domain consistency.

63: R_Patient CMET is used for record target and subject. R_Patient includes the A_PrincipalCareProvision CMET that provides the capability for documenting the GP/PCP as well as other providers for the patient.
67: Multiple Race and Ethnicities

9: Deceased time handled by using R_Patient CMET 42: Employment info for patient included in R_Patient 47: R_Patient allows documentation of groups of non-person living subjects, but still limits persons to a single instance.
47, 53: Use of R-InvestigativeSubject for record target/subject allows documenting populations and groups.
52: Separated XFRM from other other relatedDocument types. The target document is an XFRM of the source document. CDA R2 had this wrong!
19: code is now CD

constraints.text: versionNumber constrained to integer valued strings

notes.text: Probably need to block all Context conduction in these AR’s.
52: Need to determine what AR type codes to include where the parent document is the target

constraints.text: A conformant CDA document can have yada, yada, yada.

notes.text: Description
